result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Graham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management and Domestic Abuse.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Michael J. Graham in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Michael J. Graham in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1 & 2:  Dismissed but read in

Count 3:
2 years Probation
Undergo any counseling per agent to include Domestic Abuse and Anger Mangement
AODA & treatment
$543.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Defendant Michael J. Graham in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Defendant Michael J. Graham in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances. Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Martinez requests arraignment be set over.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael J. Graham appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stan Woodard and intern Steve Hughes. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representaiton.  State requests $500 Cash bond.  Intern Hughes has no objection to cash bond, but only $100.00 cash.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets $500.00 CASH bond.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/victim B.S.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
